ccre.cluck

Class CluckNetworkedClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • ccre.concurrency.ReporterThread
        • ccre.cluck.CluckNetworkedClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CluckChannelListener, CluckSubscriptionListener, java.lang.Runnable

    public class CluckNetworkedClient
extends ReporterThread
implements CluckChannelListener, CluckSubscriptionListener
    A single endpoint of a Cluck connection. Both sides will transmit subscribed messages from their CluckNodes.
    See Also:
    CluckNetworkedServer

    • Nested Class Summary

        The DataInputStream behind this connection.

        A lock to be acquired for writing to the output stream.

      • shouldRun

        protected boolean shouldRun
        Active flag. Set to false to stop the client. Use stopClient() to do that.
        See Also:
        stopClient()

      • otherEndWants

        protected CArrayList<java.lang.String> otherEndWants
        The list of what the other end of the connection wants.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CluckNetworkedClient

        public CluckNetworkedClient(java.lang.String name,
                    int port,
                    CluckNode node)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Connect to the given address and port, and create a client to handle the connection.
        Parameters:
        name - the address to connect to.
        port - the port number to connect to, probably 80.
        node - the CluckNode to synchronize.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs.

    • Method Detail

      • stopClient

        public void stopClient()
        Stop the client. The client's thread will stop as soon as possible.

      • threadBody

        protected void threadBody()
                   throws java.lang.Throwable
        Description copied from class: ReporterThread
        The body of the thread. This will be called when the thread starts. This is guarenteed to be called precisely once by the ReporterThread.
        Specified by:
        threadBody in class ReporterThread
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - if something goes wrong. this will be caught by the ReporterThread automatically.

      • receive

        public void receive(java.lang.String channel,
           byte[] data)
        Description copied from interface: CluckChannelListener
        Called when data has been received on a specific channel. Should not modify data because it is the same array sent to all instances of this function.
        Specified by:
        receive in interface CluckChannelListener
        Parameters:
        channel - The channel that the data was received on.
        data - The data that was received.

        Description copied from interface: CluckSubscriptionListener

        Parameters:

        Description copied from interface: CluckSubscriptionListener

        Parameters:
